posts.post_content: My favorite choice for a mono-black EDH general. He's mana and life hungry, but a Vampire theme in the deck will give you access to [Nirkana Revenant](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nirkana Revenant) and repeated [Malakir Bloodwitch](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Malakir Bloodwitch) activations from his ability and a sacrifice outlet, partially solving both of those problems. His final Nightmare exiling ability can be a issue, particularly since protecting him in a mono-black deck can be an issue, but [Muck Drubb](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Muck Drubb), [Blessing of Leeches](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blessing of Leeches) and Shroud-granting equipment can give him at least some degree of safety.
posts.html:
My favorite choice for a mono-black EDH general. He's mana and life hungry, but a Vampire theme in the deck will give you access to Nirkana Revenant and repeated Malakir Bloodwitch activations from his ability and a sacrifice outlet, partially solving both of those problems. His final Nightmare exiling ability can be a issue, particularly since protecting him in a mono-black deck can be an issue, but Muck Drubb, Blessing of Leeches and Shroud-granting equipment can give him at least some degree of safety.

posts.post_content: Such a nasty general! Life loss doesnt really matter just make sure you have [Sangromancer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sangromancer), and any life gain equipment and you'll be sure to gain your life straight back, while dealing a huge blow to thier life and establishing huge board pressence. Also make sure to have a sac outlet like [Viscera Seer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Viscera Seer) so that if they board wipe you sac all your creatures in response and let chainer die so that they do not get exiled.

posts.post_content:
Not that it really matters in most cases, but if you don't want to worry about the nightmares getting removed when he leaves play, remove him in response to playing his ability; then his triggered ability will go on the stack before the revived "nightmare" come into play.   
  
Great for deal with pesky eldrazi... especially coupled with [Seal of Doom](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Seal of Doom)
posts.html:
Not that it really matters in most cases, but if you don't want to worry about the nightmares getting removed when he leaves play, remove him in response to playing his ability; then his triggered ability will go on the stack before the revived "nightmare" come into play.

Great for deal with pesky eldrazi... especially coupled with Seal of Doom
